module.name: term/real
module.description:
This module contains strategies for operating on real numbers.
In Stratego, real numbers are primitive terms, separate from integers. The precision of the reals match that of the underlying runtime platform, which currently always is the ANSI C library.
module.author: Eelco Visser <visser@acm.org>
Karl Trygve Kalleberg <karltk@strategoxt.org> - documentation

strategy.name: is-real
strategy.description: Predicate to check if the current term is a real number.

strategy.name: cos
strategy.description: Compute cosine of a real number.

strategy.name: sin
strategy.description: Compute sine of a real number.

strategy.name: sqrt
strategy.description:
Compute square of a real number.
Note: The number sqrt is applied to must be non-negative, as complex numbers are not supported.

strategy.name: atan2
strategy.description: Compute arc tangent of a par of real numbers. The result, when applied to the pair (x,y), is the arc tangent of y/x, expressed as radians between -PI and PI. The signs of the parameters x and y are used to determine the correct quadrant.

strategy.name: real-to-string
strategy.description: Convert a real to a string with default (maximal) precision.

strategy.name: real-to-string
strategy.description:
Convert a real to a string with given precision.
The term argument prec specifies the number of digits after the period is required. The result is rounded.
Example: <real-to-string(2)> 12.124 => "12.12"

strategy.name: string-to-real
strategy.description:
Construct a real from a string.
Example: <string-to-real> "123.0e+02"

strategy.name: real
strategy.description: Construct a real from an int.
